body: Because of his shitty commie fanbase, Dream was pressured to ban Jschlatt from his server because he made jokes about China, and he actually went through with it. There’s videos of it on youtube so if you want to see it firsthand you can search for those.
body_html: Because of his shitty commie fanbase, Dream was pressured to ban Jschlatt from his server because he made jokes about China, and he actually went through with it. There’s videos of it on youtube so if you want to see it firsthand you can search for those.

body:
I don't like any of the "gods" because their popularity is illegitimate. All of them.

The only reason they got popular is because YouTube decided to set them up as industry plants, and gave them all kinds of high quality video equipment, software, channel art, videos ideas, etc. Dream and GeorgeNotFound were apparently linked to Skeppy, although Skeppy is nowhere near as big as Dream so that doesn't explain it. And I'm pretty sure Fundy was non-existent until November.

I always watched people who spent years putting the actual work into it, and now I see these guys having like 30 videos and going from 0 to a million subscribers in half a year without even trying, and every single one of their videos gets millions of views (with no search engine optimization even), 100% of the time without fail (for comparison, the legit popular channels get an average of 300k views per video). The reason is because YouTube wants to make them popular figures to make money from them, so they purposely make sure that all their videos get suggested to everyone and show up all over the trending pages. As a result this buries everyone else.
body_html:
I don't like any of the "gods" because their popularity is illegitimate. All of them.

The only reason they got popular is because YouTube decided to set them up as industry plants, and gave them all kinds of high quality video equipment, software, channel art, videos ideas, etc. Dream and GeorgeNotFound were apparently linked to Skeppy, although Skeppy is nowhere near as big as Dream so that doesn't explain it. And I'm pretty sure Fundy was non-existent until November.

I always watched people who spent years putting the actual work into it, and now I see these guys having like 30 videos and going from 0 to a million subscribers in half a year without even trying, and every single one of their videos gets millions of views (with no search engine optimization even), 100% of the time without fail (for comparison, the legit popular channels get an average of 300k views per video). The reason is because YouTube wants to make them popular figures to make money from them, so they purposely make sure that all their videos get suggested to everyone and show up all over the trending pages. As a result this buries everyone else.
